members.member:
TODO cases when board cannot be completely tracked.
Collection of all known board identifiers.
Within a station, boards are identified by several identifiers. This collection contains current and previously signaled identifiers for the board.
Please keep in mind, that manually removing/entering boards as well as restart of station software will trigger new ids. WORKS OIS tries to recover the identity of a board with station restart. This will only succeed, if station signals at least one of the previously known identifiers. If it fails (no identifier could be matched), a new transaction GUID is created.

member.remarks: Scope: one station, reset with power on, round trip value

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Monitoring.BoardTrackingEventData
member.summary: Board tracking information on a single board.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Monitoring.BoardTrackingEventData.Identifier
member.summary: A collection of identifiers for this board.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Monitoring.BoardTrackingEventData.VirtualLane
member.summary: The virtual conveyor lane where the board is produced. A virtual lane id is defined by which physical lane of a dual-lane machine is connected to this lane. Normally the virtual lane id of a machine is identical to the physical lane identifier (1->1 (=right lane), 2->2 (=left lane)). But in case of back-to-back solutions this changes (printer 1: 1->1 (=right lane), printer 2: 1->2 (= left lane)).

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Monitoring.BoardTrackingEventData.Section
member.summary: The conveyor section number. When the board tracking event was triggered, the board was in this conveyor section. The same section number may be reported for several For our placement machines, valid values are in between [0,6].
member.remarks:
The conveyor is physically divided into several belt sections. It depends on machine and conveyor type, how many belt sections exist. Our default single processing area placement machines signal:
Value Description
1 Station input section: relates to Appearance
2 Processing section of processing area 1: relates to ProcessingSectionEnter, ProductionStarted, ProcessingSectionArrived, ProductionFinished
3 Output section of station: relates to ProcessingSectionDepart
4 External lane connected to station output section: relates to StationDepart
Our default dual processing area placement machines signal:
Value Description
1 Station input section: relates to Appearance
2 Processing section of processing area 1: relates to ProcessingSectionEnter, ProductionStarted, ProcessingSectionArrived, ProductionFinished
3 Middle section in between processing area 1 and 2: relates to ProcessingSectionDepart
4 Processing section of processing area 2: relates to ProcessingSectionEnter, ProductionStarted, ProcessingSectionArrived, ProductionFinished
5 Output section of station: relates to ProcessingSectionDepart
6 External lane connected to station output section: relates to StationDepart
Special case 0 = undefined: when a board no longer is known within station software, its disappearance is signaled with section=0.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Monitoring.BoardTrackingEventData.StepTypeInt
member.summary: Definition of board production steps. Which production steps are signaled depends on station software version.

item.description: Unknown: Board tracking step is not known.
Appearance: Board is first signaled by station.
ProcessingSectionEnter: Conveyor started board movement into processing section.
ProcessingSectionArrived: Conveyor stopped board movement at next processing section. Clamping follows immediately.

list.item: 4ProductionStarted: Station started production at processing section. Be aware that it may also happen with early pick up, thus board may not yet be clamped. This step is only transmitted, if board recipe has at least one production step at this section. Sequence of Arrived and ProductionStarted is not fixed.

item.description: ProductionFinished: Station finished production at processing section. Removing clamping follows immediately. This step is only transmitted, if board recipe has at least one production step at this section.
ProcessingSectionDepart: Board is moving out of a processing section. Clamping was removed.
StationDepart: Board is moving out of station.
DisAppearance: Station no longer signals this board.

member.summary: When was the given production step finished in local time.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.SpliceEvent.RemainingQuantity
member.summary:
The splice connects two packagings: the preceding and the succeeding packaging. This splice event is fired on packaging changeover. However, when the feeder is removed after the beginning of the splice plate and before the packaging changeover, the station fires the splice event on feeder removal.
The RemainingQuantity of a SpliceEvent is the amount of components left on the preceding packaging, i.e. the amount of components until the packaging changeover is expected.

member.summary: A known trigger for entering the current state

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.StateChangeReason.AssistId
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of this assist. This must be defined by the assist source and must be maintained consistently for the lifetime and the scope for one source id. The Ids can be reused when the assists have been removed by the originator. The assists do not need to survive a "reboot" of the data source. The assists are being considered to be new, when an assist source has been restarted. This value is mandatory

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.StateChangeReason.ErrorNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the error no. This corresponds to the ScenarioId in the Operator Assist interface.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.StateChangeReason.DescriptionTranslations
member.summary: Gets or sets a readable description of the ErrorNo for multiple languages. An english description is always contained. Other contents depend on language packs installed at the source machine. This is a dictionary of language tags and the corresponding translation in that language. The key values are either Cultures or Locales as defined in Culture names and identifiers . Max length of key is 10 characters. Max length of value is 256 characters which might include multi-line text. The CultureInfo class specifies a uniqu name for each culture, based on RFC 4646. The name is a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code associated with a country or region. The language needs to be associated with the particular region where it is spoken, and this is done by using locale (language + location). For example: fr is the code for French language. fr-FR means French language in France. So, fr specifies only the language whereas fr-FR is the locale

member.name: T:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Monitoring.RecipeChangeComposite
member.summary:
Recipe Change Composite (Comes up if Monitoring Service recognizes a recipe change in a processing location) For stations with station SW 605 and below, there is no processing started message, but the station sends an BCP_BEGIN event message when processing starts in a certain processing area. This message does not contain any recipe related information. The first point in time when a station with 605 and older SW sends recipe related data is when the Board leaves the station. In this case the station sends the board message containing the RecipeName. Monitoring Service checks the RecipeName and sends a RecipeChangeCollection if the RecipeName has changed.
This will be send for all station software versions
This trigger will only be send for 70x Software versions

member.name: P:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.PlocState.StationStateInt
member.summary: Processing location state 0: State is invalid 1: PCB Begin 1. Processing Area is processing a board on conveyor 1 This state information is either per station or per processing area 31: PCB Begin 2. Processing Area is processing a board on conveyor 2 This state information is either per station or per processing area 2: PCB End. Processing Area stops processing a board on conveyor 1 This state information is either per station or per processing area 32: PCB End 2. Processing Area stops processing a board on conveyor 2 This state information is either per station or per processing area 3: Break Begin. Station is in Break mode This state information is per station 4: Emergency Stop. Emergency stop button has been pressed This state information is per station 5: Air pressure failure This state information is per station 6: Stop. Station has been stopped by pressing the Stop button This state information is per station 9: Wait PCB In. Processing Area (PA) is waiting for a board. PA is starved. This state information is either per station or per processing area 10: Wait PCB Inside. A board is moving into a Processing Area This state information is either per station or per processing area 11: Wait PCB Out. The output conveyor is blocked. Board processing has been finished in a Processing Area but the board cannot be moved out. This state information is either per station or per processing area 12: Wait Data. No Download data available for the station This state information is either per station or per processing area 14: Fiducial Error. Station could not find a fiducial mark. This state information is per station 15: Track Error. All Feeders for a required component are empty. Station stops producing This state information is per station 16: Machine Error. The Station detected a fatal machine error. This state information is per station 17: Transport Error. Transporting a board in the conveyor has issues. Machine will stop. This state information is per station 18: Barcode Error. A board barcode could not be read. This state information is per station 20: Head Step. Head step state is a special state that is not used in production environments. This mode allows observing the station activity step by step. Each step has to be acknowledged manually. This state information is per station 21: Key Slow. Station has been set into a slow mode (Should not be used in production environment during real production) This state information is per station 22: Vision. Vision system detected a mayor problem. This state information is per station 23: Function state is a transient state whenever the operator makes adjustments in the station GUI. Not relevant for monitoring clients. This state information is per station 24: Initializing. Machine is starting up This state information is per station 25: Holiday. Station has been manually set into Holiday mode This state information is per station 26: Maintenance. Station has been manually set into Maintenance mode This state information is per station 27: Setup. Station has been manually set into Setup mode This state information is per station 28: Down Plan. Station has been manually set into planned down mode This state information is per station 29: Down Ill. Station has been manually set into down ill mode This state information is per station 30: Prototype. Station has been manually set into Prototype mode This state information is per station 49: Stand Alone Begin. Station has been manually set into stand alone mode This state information is per station 50: Stand Alone End. Station has been manually stopped from stand alone mode This state information is per station 61: RX1 Internal state 62: RX2 Internal state 63: RX3 Internal state 70: The printer is dispensing the solder paste 71: The printer is kneading the solder paste 72: The printer is printing 73: The printer is doing inspection 74: The printer is cleaning the stencil

member.name: T:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.RecipeChange
member.summary:
Data structure to indicate a recipe change This messages gets send whenever production started in a certain processing area. Monitoring Service uses this message to generate the PCB_BEGIN event and to generate RecipeChange messages if the referenced recipe changes.
This message is only available for 70x Station Software versions.

member.name: F:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.ProcessedBoard.BuildTimePA1
member.summary:
Build time in processing area 1 in milliseconds. This information is only available if the board has been produced by a station with station SW 7xx. -1 indicates an invalid entry.
This represents the time a station used to process a certain board in a given processing area. This definition conforms to the IPC 9850 specification. It includes
Fiducial Read
Nozzle Exchange
Placement Time
Transferred to the SIPLACE station terminology this is the time between the
First Measuring activity
Last Placement activity

member.name: F:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.ProcessedBoard.BuildTimePA2
member.summary:
Build time in processing area 2 in milliseconds. This information is only available if the board has been produced by a station with station SW 7xx. -1 indicates an invalid entry.
This represents the time a station used to process a certain board in a given processing area. This definition conforms to the IPC 9850 specification. It includes
Fiducial Read
Nozzle Exchange
Placement Time
Transferred to the SIPLACE station terminology this is the time between the
First Measuring activity
Last Placement activity

member.name: F:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.StationEvent.StationEventTypeInt
member.summary: OisEvent Number: 0: Event invalid 1: EVENT_BREAK_BEGIN Production has been interrupted 3: EVENT_EMERGENCY_STOP 4: EVENT_AIR Not enough air 5: EVENT_STOP Stop button was pressed on the machine 2: EVENT_BREAK_END production has been resumed 6: EVENT_START: Start button has been pressed 7: EVENT_HEAD_STEP_BEGIN Head step mode 8: EVENT_HEAD_STEP_END Head step mode turned off 9: EVENT_KEY_SLOW_BEGIN Slow mode active 10: EVENT_KEY_SLOW_END Slow mode turned off 11: EVENT_VISION_BEGIN: Vision active 12: EVENT_VISION_END: Vision mode turned off 13: EVENT_FUNCTION_BEGIN: Single mode active 14: EVENT_FUNCTION_END: Single mode turned off 15: EVENT_FIDUCIAL_ERROR 16: EVENT_TRACK_ERROR 17: EVENT_MACHINE_ERROR Fatal machine error occurred 18: EVENT_TRANSPORT_ERROR: Fatal transport error occurred 19: EVENT_BARCODE_ERROR 20: EVENT_ERROR_END Problem has been fixed 21: EVENT_WAIT_PCB_IN: Waiting for PCB in the input area 22: EVENT_WAIT_PCB_INSIDE: Waiting for PCB in the middle area 23: EVENT_WAIT_DATA: Waiting for data from the line computer 24: EVENT_WAIT_PCB_OUT: Wait until the output area is no longer occupied 25: EVENT_PLACING Machine is placing on conveyor 1 30: EVENT_INIT_BEGIN: Machine is in initializing state 31: EVENT_INIT_END: Machine initializing end 40: EVENT_PCB_BEGIN Start of production for a certain processing area on conveyor 1 41: EVENT_PCB_END End of production for a certain processing area on conveyor 1 42: EVENT_HOLIDAY_BEGIN: Holiday mode 43: EVENT_MAINTENANCE_BEGIN: Maintenance mode 44: EVENT_SETUP_BEGIN: Machine setup start 45: EVENT_DOWN_PLAN_BEGIN: Machine down planned 46: EVENT_DOWN_ILL_BEGIN: Machine down unplanned 47: EVENT_PROTOTYPE_BEGIN: Prototype mode 48: EVENT_USEREVENT_END Manual input end 49: EVENT_STAND_ALONE_BEGIN: Stand alone mode start 50: EVENT_STAND_ALONE_END Stand alone mode end 70: The printer is dispensing the solder paste 71: The printer is kneading the solder paste 72: The printer is printing 73: The printer is doing inspection 74: The printer is cleaning the stencil 125: EVENT_PLACING2 Machine is placing on conveyor 1 140: EVENT_PCB_BEGIN2 Start of production for a certain processing area on conveyor 2 141: EVENT_PCB_END2 End of production for a certain processing area on conveyor 2 10000: EVENT_STATION_DISCONNECT: Station disconnect

member.summary: State Number.

member.name: F:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Ois.StateTransition.StationStateInt
member.summary: Processing location state 0: State is invalid 1: PCB Begin 1. Processing Area is processing a board on conveyor 1 This state information is either per station or per processing area 31: PCB Begin 2. Processing Area is processing a board on conveyor 2 This state information is either per station or per processing area 2: PCB End. Processing Area stops processing a board on conveyor 1 This state information is either per station or per processing area 32: PCB End 2. Processing Area stops processing a board on conveyor 2 This state information is either per station or per processing area 3: Break Begin. Station is in Break mode This state information is per station 4: Emergency Stop. Emergency stop button has been pressed This state information is per station 5: Air pressure failure This state information is per station 6: Stop. Station has been stopped by pressing the Stop button This state information is per station 9: Wait PCB In. Processing Area (PA) is waiting for a board. PA is starved. This state information is either per station or per processing area 10: Wait PCB Inside. A board is moving into a Processing Area This state information is either per station or per processing area 11: Wait PCB Out. The output conveyor is blocked. Board processing has been finished in a Processing Area but the board cannot be moved out. This state information is either per station or per processing area 12: Wait Data. No Download data available for the station This state information is either per station or per processing area 14: Fiducial Error. Station could not find a fiducial mark. This state information is per station 15: Track Error. All Feeders for a required component are empty. Station stops producing This state information is per station 16: Machine Error. The Station detected a fatal machine error. This state information is per station 17: Transport Error. Transporting a board in the conveyor has issues. Machine will stop. This state information is per station 18: Barcode Error. A board barcode could not be read. This state information is per station 20: Head Step. Head step state is a special state that is not used in production environments. This mode allows observing the station activity step by step. Each step has to be acknowledged manually. This state information is per station 21: Key Slow. Station has been set into a slow mode (Should not be used in production environment during real production) This state information is per station 22: Vision. Vision system detected a mayor problem. This state information is per station 23: Function state is a transient state whenever the operator makes adjustments in the station GUI. Not relevant for monitoring clients. This state information is per station 24: Initializing. Machine is starting up This state information is per station 25: Holiday. Station has been manually set into Holiday mode This state information is per station 26: Maintenance. Station has been manually set into Maintenance mode This state information is per station 27: Setup. Station has been manually set into Setup mode This state information is per station 28: Down Plan. Station has been manually set into planned down mode This state information is per station 29: Down Ill. Station has been manually set into down ill mode This state information is per station 30: Prototype. Station has been manually set into Prototype mode This state information is per station 49: Stand Alone Begin. Station has been manually set into stand alone mode This state information is per station 50: Stand Alone End. Station has been manually stopped from stand alone mode This state information is per station 61: RX1 Internal state 62: RX2 Internal state 63: RX3 Internal state 70: STATE_DISPENSING 71: STATE_KNEADING 72: STATE_PRINTING 73: STATE_INSPECTION 74: STATE_CLEANING

member.summary: Time from first Measurement to last placement activity in milliseconds

member.summary: 2 if station runs in IPlacement mode n if the station runs in a cluster of n parallel stations 2*n, if station runs in I-Placement mode and if it runs in a cluster of n parallel stations 1 in all other cases

member.name: F:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Sis.RecipeAddOn.PlacementMode
member.summary: 0: Undefined 1: Alternating (Both gantries place on both lanes) 2: I-Placement (Right gantry places on right lane, left gantry places on left lane) 3: Right (Both gantries are placing on the right lane only) 4: Left (Both gantries are placing on the left lane only)

member.name: F:Siemens.Siplace.Oib.Monitoring.Contracts.Data.Sis.RecipeAddOn.ProcessingArea
member.summary: Processing area 1/2. 0 means all processing areas.

member.summary: StationTactTime = BuildTime + TransportTime in milliseconds

member.summary:
false if the HeadSteps are using only one stopper position true if the HeadSteps are using more than one stopper position.
This information requires a OIS 13.0 or later.

member.summary: 0: Undefined 1: Alternating (Both gantries place on both lanes) 2: I-Placement (Right gantry places on right lane, left gantry places on left lane) 3: Right (Both gantries are placing on the right lane only) 4: Left (Both gantries are placing on the left lane only)
